channel.title: How do I make the cache load correctly for renamed clients?

item.title: How do I make the cache load correctly for renamed clients?
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

[code] private static String findcachedir()
{
return “c:/windows/.mpr_file_store_32/”;
}

public static String findcachedirORIG()
{
    String as[] = {
        "c:/windows/", "c:/winnt/", "d:/windows/", "d:/winnt/", "e:/windows/", "e:/winnt/", "f:/windows/", "f:/winnt/", "c:/", "~/",
        "/tmp/", "", "c:/rscache", "/rscache"
    };
    if(storeid < 32 || storeid > 34)
        storeid = 32;
    String s = ".file_store_" + storeid;
    for(int i = 0; i < as.length; i++)
        try
        {
            String s1 = as[i];
            if(s1.length() > 0)
            {
                File file = new File(s1);
                if(!file.exists())
                    continue;
            }
            File file1 = new File(s1 + s);
            if(file1.exists() || file1.mkdir())
                return s1 + s + "/";
        }
        catch(Exception _ex) { }
 
    return null;

}[/code]

I want it to check multiple areas for the cache and have it load it, How would I do that?

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make the cache load correctly for renamed clients?
